intro: Juncus compressus var. gracillimus, commonly known as the slender rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Juncaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like clusters of pale green to brown flowers. This variety is native to wetland and marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its compact growth habit and ability to stabilize soil make it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
